title.narrative: Building skills and resilience of vulnerable Lebanese and Refugee women in South and Mount Lebanon

description.narrative:
In close coordination with all agencies operating in the community, including local churches, voluntary organisations and the Social Development Centres related to the Ministry of Social affairs, a women's empowerment project will be implemented in the south and Mount Lebanon to enhance the well-being of the local Lebanese communities and of Syrian (and potentially Iraqi) refugees. The project will form and train women's committees, and through them provide information and outreach sessions, and offer referrals to other services where appropriate. Community outreach sessions will provide skills training to build the capacity of women to cope with the challenges of everyday life, manage stress and respond to domestic violence which has increased during the pandemic. Furthermore, by accessing vocational opportunities the women will further increase their resilience and potentially access informal livelihoods opportunities. 20 women will receive training in home and community healthcare which can lead directly to employment in hospitals or in home care.
This project will be targeting women, Lebanese and Syrian and some Iraqi in Mount Lebanon, living in two marginalised areas where there is a lack of projects targeting women and high levels of poverty and poor living conditions. The project will help to improve the conditions which can contribute to more peaceful communities by creating spaces where women from host and refugee communities can dialogue together, share challenges, participate in joint activities and adopt positive behaviours which can lead to improved social cohesion.
